Question
========
Suppose that the current American president claims that the American
population gives the current US president an approval score of 7 (on a
scale of 1 to 10).  
  
A researcher has doubts about this claim and conducts a random survey
among 121 American respondents. This sample shows that the average
approval score is 6.5 (st.dev. = 1.8).  
  
What is the **standard error** of the sampling distribution of the
average approval score*?  
*

Answerlist
----------
* 0.1636
* 0.9491
* 0.0375
* 0.0571
* 0.0750

Solution
========










Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
* False
